author: jaesharp#0

content:
i found skills is a really good way to fill the gaps in training and have up to date packages etc. I made a plugin that makes skills from a claude.ai research document.
As a proof of concept for composability of skills and how effect topical skills are at increasing code quality i made a plugin for writing unit tests that using those two concepts. The core is agnostic and skills bolt on to it for language support. 
First language it supports is type script is flutter, with generated skills i can write good idiomatic unit tests. I am about to try typescript with jest as a bolt on.
I pushed it as well, i ran the skills with opus, sonnet, haiku, glm and minimax. Minimax is the only one that had problems, haiku gives slightly more verbose outputs with 5-7 more unneeded tests. the other 3 work perfectly. 
Because this is composable i swapped the planning and redundancy checks in the haiku runs to use opus and that fixed it, those are agents that rely only on training - no skills needed, haiku handled the implementation using the skills no porblems.
author: stachefkapatass#0

content: this is a bit of a tangent, but it might be interesting to try using skills for self documentation. Almost like an FAQ for the agent to compliment CLAUDE.md's
author: duckbow.#0

content: though i suppose maybe that's worse than just having it reference actual documentation
author: duckbow.#0

content:
I also did this in the topical skills creation plugin, what it does is takes in a concept and then it searches your code base and writes an architecture document about your code base and puts the document into documents/architecture/ then from that document generates a skill putting that information at the finger tips of claude.
I automated it to the point where you can have it investigate your entire code base come back to you and suggest concepts to build documents for, you choose the ones one want it then generates the the documentation and a skill for each.
This is a fantastic way to burn all your tokens o.0. hahah
There is a balance to this one you don't want to add these before architecture is established and wont change anymore other wise you get stale data quickly. It's good for established brownfield where you dont expect the styling system or layers etc to change much.
author: stachefkapatass#0

content: It is also composable, so you can just do one concept if you like
